As an AI language model, I can provide examples of books that have been criticized for promoting unhealthy relationship dynamics, but it's important to note that criticisms can be subjective and vary among readers. Here are some examples:

- "Twilight" by Stephenie Meyer has been criticized for romanticizing an abusive and controlling relationship between the main characters Bella and Edward. Edward exhibits stalking behavior, manipulates Bella's choices, and is possessive to an extreme degree.

- "Fifty Shades of Grey" by E.L. James has been criticized for promoting a toxic relationship in which the male protagonist, Christian Grey, displays controlling and abusive behavior towards Ana. The book has been widely criticized for normalizing and even glamourizing BDSM practices.

- "The Great Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald features a dramatic and obsessive love story that has been criticized for portraying an unhealthy relationship dynamic between the characters Gatsby and Daisy. Gatsby is consumed with his love for Daisy to the point of obsession, and the novel has been criticized for portraying an idealized and unrealistic relationship.

These books are just a few examples, and there may be many more books that could be criticized for promoting unhealthy relationship dynamics. It is essential to be critical of the messages that books, movies, and other media are promoting and to encourage safer and more respectful relationship dynamics in all forms of media.
